website_summaries.verdict: Really can help senior cats move better and get back to their old selves.
pros: The combination of  glucosamine and chondroitin sulfate seems to really help cats with arthritis
Good for once or twice a day with feedings
Capsules open and can be powdered over food
cons: You have to open the capsule and sprinkle the powder on your cats food

customer_reviews.title: Working for bladder issue!
customer_reviews.text: I am using Cosequin for cystitis as other reviewers have mentioned. He was doing OK with one capsule a day, going a few months without a bout, but he has been doing much better with one capsule in the morning and one in the evening (several months now). He weighs about 14 lbs. I mix it with wet food and he eats it right up. I am hopeful that this is the long-term solution I've been looking for. Paws are crossed.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Remedy for feline cystitis and UTIs
customer_reviews.text: Cosequin was recommended to me for cat UTI problems. Good news is - you don't have to pill your cat! Just open the capsule, sprinkle on their food and mix in. Since I've been using Cosequin, almost 1 year now, cats haven't had any UTI issues. Prior to using Cosequin we were taking them to the vet every 4 months or so for urinary tract problems.
customer_reviews.author: Laura @ Island Paws Studio

customer_reviews.title: wonderful wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: wonderful wonderful product! This has helped my male cat who had a bout of bladder crystals and my elder cat with her arthritis! If your kitty is aging or having bladder crystal issues then by all means do not hesitate to get this supplement. Seymour won't eat it in his wet food but Mama Cat will and so I just add a capsule to some pumpkin and give it to him via a feeding syringe. Update: Seymour will now eat his wet food with this mixed in. I had to titrate up to a full capsule. I now give this to all 7 of my cats and I can tell it's made a wonderful difference for all of them.
customer_reviews.author: Kara R.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: CAUSED SEIZURES
customer_reviews.text: These actually TRIGGERED SEIZURES in my elderly cat!!!!!! BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.author: Wendi Johnson

customer_reviews.title: My cats are moving & shaking again!!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 cats that are approximately 18 & 19 years old, both female and quite spry for their age. They run up and down the carpeted stairs as they "own" the second floor of the house! One was recently limping & dragging her back leg as if she had hurt her back or hindquarters with all the jumping. I ordered this product, thinking a conservative approach might help. Within 2-3 DAYS, she was walking near normal & after completing the first bottle she is running up the stairs like she dropped several years overnight. Great product! I'm sorry I didn't start them on it earlier. It's wonderful to see them doing so well.
customer_reviews.author: Lexie

customer_reviews.title: Smelled Funny Could Not Use
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it was just thus bottle since I have never purchased this product before but know other people who use it, as soon as I opened the sealed bottle there is a very strong stale smell. I opened up a capsule to sprinkle on food and even I could smell it in the contents of one capsule after mixed in the food! Expiration date was years away. Obviously could not trick the cat into eating it and will throw the whole bottle away maybe purchase again locally instead see if have the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Scouten

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased after my cat was diagnosed with arthritis. I break open one capsule in her food every morning and she loves the capsule flavor mixed in with her food. After about 5 days, noticed an big improvement in her mood ( relating to pain I think) and in her mobility. SHe was bright eyed and more like herself. I have since added Canna-Pet (special hemp flour)and she made a huge leap in her mobility and no longer limps unless she pushes herself and jumps when she shouldn't.
customer_reviews.author: Rebeca

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Seems to make my cat throw up whenever I try to use it
customer_reviews.author: Leah R.

customer_reviews.title: Cats like it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 9 year old cat who has started to show his age by moving around less. I also have a younger cat, but I figured it would benefit her too. The boy cat is VERY picky when it comes to food, so I was worried he wouldn't eat food with this sprinkled on. But I was wrong & both cats will wait to eat their food until I add the Cosequin! They love it for some reason. I haven't noticed any drastic changes, but the older cat does seem to be a little more mobile & willing to go up/down stairs. I just ordered another larger bottle to continue the supplement.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey G.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: These work wonders!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old cat began limping and showing all the signs of stiff joints this past summer. He spent most of his days just sleeping and generally being grumpy. I could see how miserable he was. After doing some research I came across these pills. I mix in two pills with some wet cat food each day and after taking them a little over a month, he's moving around with ease and back to being a great cat again. I'm so happy they work and they couldn't be easier to feed to a cat.
customer_reviews.author: pinkiowagirl

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Our 16 year old cat has slowed down a lot and we noticed her joints were bothering her after laying down for awhile. Have been able to sprinkle this into her wet food, and she eats it just fine. This cat is very difficult to get meds down, and will sniff anything out of food we try to sneak meds into....she has no problem with this at all. We just open the capsule, stir it into the food, and she eats it up. She certainly has better movement now that she gets this on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: CJ56

customer_reviews.title: Bad smell. My cat has been taking cosequin for ...
customer_reviews.text: Bad smell. My cat has been taking cosequin for over 10 years. First time using the "Professional line". It smells awful. Like bad chemicals. Made my cat sick and not want his food. Needless to say I am very upset. Not sure if this is a bad batch or faulty pills being passed off as real thing. Expires 01/21. Lot 1701125S.
customer_reviews.author: bellarats

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: I mix one of these capsules in with my Persian's wet food daily as recommended by his vet. He was suffering from bloody, painful urination that we thought was frequent UTIs, but it turns out it was bladder infections due to anxiety (they would happen whenever we would travel and last for months). Apparently, these help calm the bladder lining and he hasn't had a flare-up in years. In conjunction with the Feliway cat pheromone plug-ins to calm him, we have completely reversed a painful issue that had been happening for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: H. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I have a 14 year old cat with some arthritis in her shoulder, she also has some issues with feline lower urinary tract disease. This product has made a huge difference for both problems. She no longer limps and will still play with her toys like a younger cat and she has not had an episode of cystitis since we started her on these. We feed one capsule twice a day sprinkled over her wet food, she eats it up with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: CAfarmgirlTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for old cats!
customer_reviews.text: Kitty is 19 and has been on this supplement for at least 5 years. I notice she starts to look rigid and rickety if we don't give it to her for a week. We initially gave it every other day but went to every day a couple years back when we got a 2-story home. It has continued to help her joints and she still goes up and down the stairs like a champ. The picture shows Kitty still spry enough to jump on and clamber up the recliner and contemplate eating my plants and spry enough to jump on the couch and cuddle into an Amazon Prime box!
customer_reviews.author: Renee G.

customer_reviews.title: Really wish it was cheaper, but my cat needs this stuff
customer_reviews.text: This stuff has seemed to really help my senior cat. Being in college, it can be hard to afford it every time i need to refill my stock of it, but after skipping out on paying for it for a month, I noticed my cat's mobility suffer, and I immediately began buying it again even if my wallet cries over it. It makes a difference in my cat's life, and that's what matters to me. He plays more frequently while taking this, he sometimes still can make it on the bed with a single jump, and he has remained active.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: I guess they work - but please stop using food coloring
customer_reviews.text: I really wish they didn’t use toxic food coloring. There is no reason these need to be colored. And if they did, there are natural fruit/vegetable coloring they could use. Aside from that, I’m not totally sure they work. My senior cats still have problems jumping up onto furniture. But I’ll give it more time.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: An Old Cat Is Young Again
customer_reviews.text: I am not a doctor of any type, but seeing our elderly cat before and after using this product I see a difference. Before we started giving her this medication she would seem to be in pain. She would limp and just seem to find it hard to walk. She now runs and jumps up onto chairs on the bed. In fact when we would brush her about every other day there were certain spots that would hurt her. We can now brush her and those spots are tolerated a little more. Perhaps it's just my wish, but it seems that this medication has been a benefit.
customer_reviews.author: T. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Resolved Chronic IC
customer_reviews.text: My male cat had PU surgery when he was two due to multiple instances of bladder obstruction. As a result of that surgery he developed idiopathic cystitis. In addition to diet I tried many natural remedies over the years but only found healing with Cosequin for cats. Results were noticeable within the first week. I am amazed that I finally have this under control for him almost seven years later. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Definitely works
customer_reviews.text: I have been sprinkling this on in my cats food for over a year. You have to start with more than one capsule daily to boost their system and then you can decrease the dosing. So my cat gets one of these every other day, and on the off days I give her a cosequin chew- bc she thinks they are treats and loves them. I work in Ortho and I know that glucosamine/chondroitin genuinely help joints by feeding gut biome bacteria that then lower inflammation in your body. It sounds crazy, but I'm telling you this stuff works. If your cat is getting older and you wanna keep their joints healthy, I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: Feeling Much Better!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat has hobbled around for the past few years, until I started him on these Nutramax Cosequin capsules. My cat is 14 or 15 years old and I felt so bad for him!! He appeared to be in such pain. After starting the Cosequin he was running and wanting to play again. I sprinkle the caps on his food.. making sure to mix it in well. He just looks happier and I know I’m happier for him. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Otter

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure I got a counterfeit product. Consistency of the 80-count bottle was completely different than the 30-day blister pack. Plus, my cat started limping again after taking these caplets for a few days.
customer_reviews.author: mkk423

customer_reviews.title: Since starting this she is gettin around a lot better, is happier
customer_reviews.text: This supplement has been a miracle for out 11 year old cat. She has severe arthritis in her hind legs. The vet suggest we try a supplement before going to prescription meds or pain medication. Since starting this she is gettin around a lot better, is happier, more active, and through Amazon we are saving a ton - our vet was at least 50 % more expensive. Shipped quickly and free with Amazon prime. Suggest to anyone who is having trouble with their elderly cat prior to putting on pain medication or prescription medication.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves the flavor!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves the flavor. I open the capsule and put it in a small amount of water. I use a large plastic syringe made for liquids given to me by my vet and squirt it slowly into her mouth. She actually reaches towards the syringe and starts licking before I push the plunger! She is 20 and has stiff joints. This medicine seems to help.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Witnessed results in a month! Leaping cats!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 older cats are very healthy, but their jumps were decreasing & my boy's walk looked off. My hippy vet recommended this & wow! Anything is worth seeing such dramatically positive differences in my cats! My big guy will lick the powder straight from my palm, while my lil' gal prefers hers sprinkled on her food. I'm NOT a professional, but found that some cats are sensitive to the extra strength. I found that it's worth going with the lower dose & administrating twice a day as needed/directed.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: For My Older Cat
customer_reviews.text: When we adopted our cat, Missy, several years ago, she already had mobility issues. She couldn't jump very high and she walked with a limp. Over the last year or so she has not been able to jump at all and her limp has gotten worse. I ordered the Nutramax Cosequin last June and gave her one capsule everyday for 6 weeks. After only a few weeks, I noticed she was walking a lot better and even playing more with our other cat. Now, I give her a capsule every other day. She is even jumping on the back of the sofa now. I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than purchasing through my vet
customer_reviews.text: I have a (by the vet’s best guess) 6-7 year old cat who is sweet as can be but was suffering from chronic bladder issues that couldn’t be diagnosed through urinalysis, ultrasound, or x-ray. What we did find on the x-ray was some spinal compression near her pelvis that might have been contributing. This supplement killed two birds with one stone because the infection has cleared up, appetite is back, and she’s moving around like never before. She has no problems with the flavor despite being a bit picky about her food and will even eat it with dry food (I mist it a bit before I give it to her so it sticks).
customer_reviews.author: Evangeline

customer_reviews.title: Really works for arthritis
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old cat developed arthritis and I wasn’t sure what could be done to help her. My vet recommended finding something on Amazon and I chose this based upon the reviews. These pills really work. My cat was not jumping up on the bed or counters anymore. Going up and down stairs was tough. When I started her on these I expected it to take awhile to see improvement. But in just under a week, she was doing so much better. She’s jumping up again on the counters and bed with no struggle. There is such a difference and it’s so good to see her moving around without issue. So thankful!
customer_reviews.author: Lori L.

customer_reviews.title: Great product to help with arthritic cat
customer_reviews.text: Our large 17 yr old cat had much difficulty moving around ( fat cat ) before taking to the vet , I decided to get this for him and within 3 days of taking it , he started moving around more & not meowing in pain . I’m sure the vet would have cost me over $200 to test & try pharmaceuticals on him which could have side effects . Our dog has been taking CosaminDS for dogs since she was 6 months old .. she is now 6 yrs old and doing great ( black lab mix )
customer_reviews.author: Simply Susie Q

customer_reviews.title: My Vet Recommended: 2 A Day Miracle, 15+ Maine Coon Mix
customer_reviews.text: My 14 years (i.e., now 15+ years) young Maine Coon mix was limping and could no longer jump. He seemed to be in distress. The vet said he was old. Reaching his end? As something that worked for some cats, he recommended two of these per day. I break open and mix the contents of two capsules in his canned food in the morning. It is now one year later ( i.e., he is over 15). There is a marked improvement. He can jump to his cat tree again and on lower objects (i.e., "his side table" in "his" home office). Even though mostly blind, ... he does leaps of faith ... and jumps. He is playful and active.
customer_reviews.author: TX-One

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be effective
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for my senior kitty, Annie. I believe it kept her active until her death at 19 years of age. My present cat. Sam, is 14 years old. Last year he became very ill, and not expected to live long. He did pull through but was not moving about much. I started giving him Annie's old Cosequin powders, and he is now thundering the length of the house and lightly leaping onto places he has not done so in 2-3 years! The capsules are easy to open and sprinkle the powder on his wet food. He never turns down wet food sprinkled with this Cosequin powder. Sam is happy, and so am I!
customer_reviews.author: Scotty

customer_reviews.title: Seems to have helped
customer_reviews.text: Our 10-year old female cat had recurring urinary infections. The last vet recommendation was to add glucosamine to her food and use an expensive prescription urinary formula food. Kitty didn't like the prescription food, and the prescription glucosamine was difficult to obtain as well as expensive. We finally found an acceptable combination of urinary formula canned food plus the Cosequin. I mix part of a capsule's powder with her morning feeding. One or both changes seems to have helped because kitty hasn't had a recurrence of infection in over two years. Who can say for certain, but I'll keep using both. The assurance and convenience of getting this from Amazon as needed plus the reasonable price is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: My cat is fussy and will not eat her Sheba pâté food if I use the whole capsule. Happily, these are little capsules that contain the powder so I sprinkle a little at a time. Half in the am and the other half in the pm and just mix it in. Very fast delivery and product is just as described. Probably won’t see any results for a few weeks as it gets into her system.
customer_reviews.author: Kcathy2011

customer_reviews.title: Back to doing what he (and we) enjoy!
customer_reviews.text: Our elderly boy kitty (14 years) who has an arthritic knee hadn't been able to get up on the couch, bed, or chair to snuggle with us for quite some time, and squawked every time we tried to pick him up to help. We set up some simple steps to encourage him, but still seemed to be too painful. Since we started mixing Nutramax into his wet food, he's been able to make his way up to join us wherever we are, and has rediscovered his favorite napping spot on the guest room bed. Nice to see him getting around so much better!
customer_reviews.author: shopsalot11

customer_reviews.title: Great results
customer_reviews.text: My fur baby is a tri-pod having lost a leg as a kitten. After 17 years of wear and tear she was showing signs of stiffness, inability to jump and slowing down. This Cosequin is incredible, she's been on it for almost a year now and the change is amazing. She's back to jumping and climbing and beating me down the stairs again for her breakfast. I thank the researchers for developing these supplememts to enable a better quality of life for our older pets.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Beware counterfeit Cosequin
customer_reviews.text: I believe I may have gotten a bottle of counterfeit Cosequin. The vet prescribed this as a remedy for my 16-year-old cat's UTI problems. I bought the first bottle from the vet and my little guy improved tremendously. I sprinkle it on his food and he chowed down. I bought a second bottle from Amazon. He turns his nose up at the food and the UTI is back. I'm heading to the vet with him this afternoon, and I will be purchasing a bottle of Cosequin from the vet. I guess the savings on Amazon sometimes do come at a price. Never again!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Works with my cat
customer_reviews.text: I suspect my cat had an injury from jumping down from too high several yrs ago and then really aggrevated it last yr. X ray shows arthritis, muscle atrophy in his knee. When it was flared up he would hardly put weight on it. Gave it to him for a month, 2 pills per day, and he did much better. Mostly normal. Since then i basically just give 1-2 pills a day if he begins limping or just infrequently as to avoid giving him pills everyday. He jumps on stuff and seems happy to do whatever he wants other than run for very long because that does cause him to limp for a few minutes afterwards.

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for senior cats
customer_reviews.text: My Newman is 13 years old and he started experiencing some muscle loss. Also, he was compulsively grooming himself from the waist down so that he was nearly naked. My poor skinny, naked cat. I started giving him cosequin and I noticed an improvement in his demeanor within days. He's been on it a couple of months now and he's letting his fur grow back in, and he's gained some weight. He eats it readily with 1/3 can of Fancy Feast. He and I are both very happy.
customer_reviews.author: linph

customer_reviews.title: A very happy cat
customer_reviews.text: My little girl is coming up on 22 years. In the last year or so, I noticed she wasn't getting around as well. I thought I'd try this to ease her arthritis, and it has certainly helped! Now, instead of the usual—thunk . . . thunk . . . thunk, down the stairs, it's become, thunk, thunk, thunk. ; ) She still won't go one leg in front of the other, it has to be the front legs, back legs as a unit. But, she's much faster and a lot lighter on her feet. Thank you for helping the old girl feel like a kitten again.
customer_reviews.author: RatingsStar

customer_reviews.title: Works for my senior cats
customer_reviews.text: I am adding the "sprinkles" to the food for three cats over fourteen years old. The capsules open easy and the sprinkles quickly disappear into a teaspoon of canned food. The results are pretty amazing. The tortie suddenly developed a liking for jumping over my 18" box fan instead of walking around it. Both the other cats went back to sleeping on top of the cabinets above my washer and dryer.
customer_reviews.author: FRG

customer_reviews.title: Putting some pep back in my cats step
customer_reviews.text: My 13.5 year old cat got a clean bill of health at the vet, but seemed to be having an increasingly more difficult time walking. He was plodding and moving more slowly. It appeared to be arthritis to me. I started him on this supplement and within a week, he seemed to be moving with more ease and standing for longer time periods. He's been getting one dose a day for about a month now, and his movement continues to improve. I mix it with a wet food treat (Hartz Delectables) and he eats it up like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helps with frequent feeling to have to pee
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat that when young exhibited a condition where she frequently felt she had to pee. She would go to the box, but most times try, but not be able to pee. I mentioned this to my vet and he indicated that he had just come from a seminar where this condition with cats of "frequent feeling to have to pee" was discussed. He said that they don't know why, but Cosequin seems to help. I started giving her one sprinkle table a day in her wet food and the condition cleared up! She is now 6 years old; I still give her one tablet a day and the condition has not returned.
customer_reviews.author: 70sMan

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive & easy to administer
customer_reviews.text: I was using this product as a recommendation from my vet for when one of my cats was having strange urinary issues. The capsules are easy to open to sprinkle the powder in the food. It mixes very easily and my cat couldn't even tell it was in his (wet) food. It seemed to have worked pretty well using a single capsule each night for maintenance in hopes that he didn't flare up again. I got to the root of the issue and no longer need to use this, but it was a much cheaper solution than getting prescription food that he didn't like. It was also much cheaper to purchase here than from the vet's office.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my senior cat when I noticed she had started to become pretty disinterested in anything going on around her and was staying in her bed more than usual. I figured her arthritic hind legs must be getting more painful. The Cosequin worked instantly! She perked up again, started interacting with us again, and even started playing again. Really it's been like night and day. I sprinkle it on her food, mix it in a little, and she eats all her food, so it appears there's no off-putting taste to the stuff. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: tiffany gramza

customer_reviews.title: My cat LOVES these.
customer_reviews.text: I tried the treats and was excited because my cat loved them. The first time. Ever since she won’t touch them. I switched to these sprinkles and now both of my cats want the food I put the medicine in. My 16 year-old cat was getting a little unsure on her feet. Well, she’s jumping again after a year of not being able to. My belief is that the product really does the job. Her walking seems “stronger” and she seems to feel better all around. I’d suggest you give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: S. Tank

customer_reviews.title: This works better than human chondroitin gluscosemine for your animal.  Do your research on this!
customer_reviews.text: This absolutely works. I sold it at Costco for 2 years. I have researched this company and received testimonials from users as well as vets. Do your animal (there is Cosequin for dogs and horses) a favor and give this to him/her the rest of his/her life. They will live a better quality life. My 18 year old cat still jumped up on anything in spite of the fact she had arthritis. She was agile until she passed.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Nearly a wonder medication for suffering kitty
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use by opening the capsules and stirring it into canned cat food, since my cat wouldn’t take a pill for anyone.. Warning, though— the capsule contents do not mix into water. The powder clumps on surface. However, if mixed into moist cat food and then has water added to that, it works well. Our older (11years), fat kitty has become downright nimble since starting the Cosequin. It was awful to see her struggle, in obvious pain, while trying to go up stairs, but she’s a new kitty, now! If people benefit from taking glucosamine for their joints, it just makes sense for animals to take it, too, just in the far smaller doses found in Cosequin.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K.

customer_reviews.title: Good for mild arthritis
customer_reviews.text: My vet suggested this to help my 13 year old cat with her arthritis but charged me $80 for a bottle! Of course it’s way less on here and I’m happy to not have to purchase it at the vet anymore. I break open a capsule on her food everyday when I feed her and the powder doesn’t seem to bother her. She’s still zooming around like usual so I’d recommend this to anyone with an aging kitty.
customer_reviews.author: catglasses12

customer_reviews.title: Easily Hidden In Food
customer_reviews.text: Our Vet suggested we use this as a way to reduce the number of urinary infections our cat got. Between the pills and one of the "Catit" water fountains, our cat seems to be doing well. The pills are made so you can take them apart and sprinkle in or over food. We mix it in with her wet cat food and she eats it okay. We had been buying these at the Vet, but they were cheaper online and will probably buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Willow

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Ok. She’s a small dog, not a cat. The dog ones don’t come in capsules that can be sprinkled on her wet food. She will not eat dog medication treats and can find ways to spit out capsules my cats didn’t know. So I tried these and they work great. She doesn’t care that they’re on her wet food. The improvement in her walk and overall movement has been dramatic. Saw improvement in the first week. I now give her three times a week for maintenance. Will increase if she shows signs of stiffness.
customer_reviews.author: Jonsnana

customer_reviews.title: This works!
customer_reviews.text: We started giving this to our now 17-year old cat about 3 or 4 years ago. It has made a huge difference in how she walks and she still jumps up onto the bed or couch fairly easily. She had been moving very stiffly for a while, which is why we decided to try this. Very happy with the result!
customer_reviews.author: Evin J. Willman

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to find this product after paying quite a bit for the Dasuquin at the vets. I thought I would get the same quality product for a cheaper price. First of all, my cat is limping again after an almost miraculous improvement while taking the Dasuquin. When I started her on the Cosequin, I was dismayed to find that the capsules only contain half the product the original capsules contained! Not only that, I am having to double up on the dose just so that she is getting the same amount as before. I definitely won't be buying this brand again. What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: C.M

customer_reviews.title: Kittyt loves it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had Katzi, my kitty, for sixteen years. She was given to me by my vet because her mother abandoned her at 3 weeks. Never sick a day but she is now 16 and has a little limp in one of her front legs. Doctor recommended Cosequin and she has been enjoying the breakfast serving served mixed with Turkey baby food. She has never been sick a day and I am so greatful for the wonderful product this is.
customer_reviews.author: Julybaby

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these capsules for about 18-10 months for my poor kitty who started having some issues jumping and moving. They have worked so well for him! I take two capsules and spread the contents over his food every morning. I also add about 1/8 teaspoon of fish oil over that and toss to coat. He doesn't seem to mind...as long as he gets his breakfast! They easy to open and sprinkle over the food. I couldn't tell you about the flavor, as I don't eat it, but my cat seems like to like it and I guess that's all that matters!
customer_reviews.author: Kat K.

customer_reviews.title: Seems to Work on Joint Issues in My Cats
customer_reviews.text: 3 of my 5 cats will eat this sprinkled on top of the food. The other two will eat if mixed into the wet food, so I mix it for all. It's supposed to be tasty to cats but finicky they are. I have been using this product for at least 5 years and it seems to work for the older ones who have some evidence of joint stiffness or arthritis. My only complaint is that delivery will not go to my physical address so I have to have it sent to my sister's house or the Amazon Locker.
customer_reviews.author: Beesting

customer_reviews.title: Cat no longer limping
customer_reviews.text: My cat was limping for nearly 2 months without getting better, and the vet was unsure of the cause but suggested giving cosequin supplements for her joint health (she's 9 years old, slightly overweight). After 3 weeks of putting 1 pill in her wet food twice a day, she was no longer limping at all. I've continued to give her the same amount for half a year now, and the limping has not come back! She's been playing a jumping a lot without any sign of pain. Would definitely recommend this product for keeping cats' joints strong.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Griffis

customer_reviews.title: Ponce de Leon missed it-this is the actual Fountain of Youth
customer_reviews.text: This is a product that I stand behind 100%. Years ago it gave a second lease on life to my 21 year old cat in the later years of her life by helping her gain back some of her mobility and made her life much more enjoyable. I now use it for my 18 year old cat with the same results. He has an arthritic hip and ever since he has been on daily Cosequin he looks and moves so much better. I have always and will always recommend this product to everyone and anyone with a cat who needs a little help getting back some of their lost youth!
customer_reviews.author: Chef Charley

customer_reviews.title: but she seemed to be getting better on her own and was not in pain
customer_reviews.text: We bough this after our cat showed obvious signs of limping all of a sudden. We were not sure exactly what she did, but she seemed to be getting better on her own and was not in pain, so we did not take her to the vet. We did wonder if she had some arthritis just because of her age. so we tried this to see if it would help. The limping did resolve quickly after we put her on this, but we have since discontinued using it and she seems fine. So, I am not sure if she does not have arthritis after all, or if this just wasn't really doing much for her.
customer_reviews.author: Jody Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Helped my cat with cystitis!
customer_reviews.text: My cat was diagnosed with cystitis two years ago and the vet said to try this to help him have less flare-ups. I give him two a day and mix it into his wet food. He went from having maybe 4 flare-ups a year to about 1 or 2. I definitely think it has helped him stay healthier than if he wasn't on it. My brother started giving it to his senior cat for joint health and after it started working she became much sprier. She's 20, but now jumping up on things again. I highly recommend it. It took a few weeks to kick in, but once it did I could see the improvement for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Skyrimir

customer_reviews.title: update 05/26/19
customer_reviews.text: almost through with the bottle. no difference in our cats limping but have only been using one capsule a day. going to order another bottle and increase to 2 caps a day and see if that helps. *** update 05/26/19 I will say that once we changed over to two capsules a day we have noticed a definite difference in our cat's limping. Much less noticeable and he is able to jump up on things again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: fast and fun.  enjoying it immensely

customer_reviews.title: Helps 20 pound cat with back/joint pain
customer_reviews.text: I have a 20 pound orange tabby cat. He has never liked being picked up. At a vet visit a few years ago, his back was sensitive during the exam. The vet had me get Cosequin for him. I open the capsule and sprinkle it on his canned food. He loves the taste. From what I can tell, it helps with his back pain, as it’s never come up again during an exam and he’s better with being picked up. Given that he’s a big boy, I feel good that he’s getting joint support.
customer_reviews.author: RemarkK

customer_reviews.title: ADDED A LITTLE SPUNK TO MY 11 year old kitty. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended this for my 11 y.o. Senior Cat, even though she was in great health. Soon after taking it for a while I noticed that she seemed to have more energy. Normally a skittish and gentle kitty, and always picked on by other kitties we had had over the years, I noticed now that she would sometimes instigate our other cat into a playful wrestling match. It was awesome to watch her. She has been on it for a year now and still has a lot of spunk. She even likes the taste of it. I’m glad I took my vets recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Senior Cat is moving around better
customer_reviews.text: Coming up on 3 months of continuous use as of this writing. I adopted a 10 yr old cat that has clearly had multiple litters in her life, she was kenneled at a shelter for several months, and she was very stiff/ unable to jump up/ lightly arthritic. I believe the daily inclusion of this formula into her wet food has contributed positively to her improvement. She can handle small jumps at this point and is moving around much faster. Overall a two fold improvement from our starting point. I'll continue to keep this supplement in her diet.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Give it some time
customer_reviews.text: It took a little while to notice a difference in my older cat. She still isn't as nimble as she once was, but her ability to jump up on the couch, bed and her cat tower has improved. Overall, this is a good product that will help improve your cat's overall quality of life.
customer_reviews.author: cerealkiller11

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This products WORKS. My kitty ate but could not do no. 2, did not play and was not herself. I took her to the vet (they charged me over $1000), gave me pain meds. When that ran out, Kitty was back to square one. I did some research on my own (spoke to another vet) and bought this product. They say there will change in 4-6 weeks. I saw change in ONE week. It has been about five weeks now. My kitty is back to normal, no. 2, playing jumping. She is in her 16th year but is very active now.
customer_reviews.author: F.S.

customer_reviews.title: Not so much
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure this might have worked well but you see my cat is very finicky and nothing I could do when I sprinkled it over his food would make him have anything to do with it so he just quit eating. So about two days later I just went in and ordered the cat treats of the same stuff and he loves them and they’re working great and I can tell he is just doing a lot better in his back legs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Won't Eat These
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my senior cat after the vet suggested them. I emptied the powder from the capsules into my cat's food as directed by the vet and he wouldn't touch his food. I have other cats and my vet said it wouldn't hurt any of them to take this, it just wouldn't benefit the younger ones as much, so I tried putting a tiny bit in each cat's wet food just to use these up (I hate wasting things). None of my cats would touch their food if even the tiniest bit of this was in their it. I had to throw them away.
customer_reviews.author: Shaina

customer_reviews.title: Fat Mac Eats Anything
customer_reviews.text: I have a “special needs” kitty named Macaroni. His front right leg is slowly morphing into a clubbed foot, so he walks a bit funny. My vet recommended a product like Cosequin to help alleviate some of the pain he’s having in the joints of that leg. I sprinkle 1 tab on his wet food mixed with about 2 tbsp of water twice a day. I haven’t noticed a notable improvement, but he gobbles up any wet food mixed with this product without turning up his nose! So that’s good!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: before Worth a try now_good to use
customer_reviews.text: We gave it to cat, although had to mix it with small food with gravy. Otherwise cat wouldn't touch it. Still waiting for feedback from cat. He hasn't told us whether it helps. It appears that it is helping. After a couple of weeks, he can go up the steps easier and can jump up on chair or bed easier. Definitely made a difference. Cat moves around a lot better; hot or cold weather. We still need to mix with a gravy like food in evening. We just pull apart and mix into gravy. Been using for about a year now. Cat is14yr.
customer_reviews.author: john w. roan

customer_reviews.title: Try it, you might be amazed.
customer_reviews.text: I can't recommend this product enough. In fact, I push it relentlessly on any friends or family with elderly kitties. We brought a 15-year-old cat into our household last year. She was creaky, cranky and clearly had pain in her back and at the base of her tail, causing her to hiss and scratch when cuddled or disturbed. After a month of these supplements and a self-heating bed, she was tearing around the house like a kitten. After a year, I have fun asking guests to guess our kitty's age. She is playful, eager to cuddle, stretch, jump and climb and she rarely gets cranky with the family anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Natty AKA Picky Polly

customer_reviews.title: Seems to help
customer_reviews.text: It's hard when a beloved pet gets older. My 16 yr old kitty seems to be a more comfortable since he started on Cosequin. It's easy to mix into his food and he doesn't hesitate to eat it. Much more effect for him than the treats that are on the market.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. Eadie

customer_reviews.title: The right price and packaging; easily mixes into wet food/water
customer_reviews.text: This supplement gave my 11 year old tabby her life back. I had noticed she was falling easily, was grumpy with me and my other kitty, and sometimes her paws cracked when bending. I started mixing this into her wet food + some extra water, and she eats it right up with no complaints. Within 3 days she was feeling better, and now with just a pill every other day she's doing great. Thank you for providing this medicine at a good price and easy application (the pills pull apart easily to distribute one dose of powder into water/wet food).
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders
customer_reviews.text: Our sweet cat is 19 years old and has very severe arthritis. Since starting him on these capsules, he walks with less difficulty and seems to be in less discomfort. I open the capsule and mix the contents with his wet food and he doesn't mind at all.
customer_reviews.author: beejay

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Has Been Taking This For Years - He's Doing Great!
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended this supplement for my cat about 8 years ago, mainly to help with his bladder, but also because he was born with a deformed spine and ribs. His vets were unsure if he'd make it much past the age of 5 yrs, but my boy is just a couple months from turning 10 yrs and he is still able to climb his cat tree, jump up on the countertops, and has an overall excellent quality of life. I'm sure these capsules are part of the reason he is still doing so well. He gets 1 capsule per day. I open it up and sprinkle the contents on his food. Works out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: M. Downey

customer_reviews.title: Same as other brands, but at a better price> I use the subscription method so it gets her every [month--] when we need it.
customer_reviews.text: It has improved our 15 year old cats ability to Jump, play, and get along like she was 8 years old. We were using [Dasiguin from the vet, but started getting he same brand from Amazon. Now we use this brand with NO DIFFERENCE, except the cat is 4 years older [Age slows us ALL down.]
customer_reviews.author: J. Lake

customer_reviews.title: Works great on older cats with joint problems. It really does work.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. It is a product that actually works great for older cats. My cat is 17 years old and she acts like a baby. Hopping around and flying all over the place. It works! The price is right for taking the best care of your pet. I recommend this product to everyone who has older cats as pets. I know that veterinarians recommend it too, because I used to work at an animal hospital. I have seen it work on many pets.
customer_reviews.author: sue

customer_reviews.title: made a huge difference for my cat
customer_reviews.text: My oldest cat is somewhere between 15 & 17 years old. I noticed that she was having difficulty walking. Like humans as we age some parts don't move as well as they used to. To be honest I had my doubts that this product would help her however it has been almost two weeks and I have noticed a measurable difference in her walking. Very happy this is working for her.
customer_reviews.author: Chichi451

customer_reviews.title: Helps relieve pain for my furbaby
customer_reviews.text: My 10-year-old cat doesn't act like a kitten, but she is still able to jump and walk with a reasonable amount of comfort. I open the capsules and mix the medicine with soft food. She eats it pretty well. I like that I can buy a bigger quantity bottle, which eliminates lots of trips to my neighboring big box store (who is often out of stock of Cosequin). When I order with Prime, the price for this bottle is about the same (or less) than my local store.
customer_reviews.author: tealady

customer_reviews.title: Arthritis-be-GONE!
customer_reviews.text: Several years ago, my 16.5 yr old DSH cat Lucy was limping. It came on fairly abruptly, so I thought she broke something. After several exams and tests, her limping was attributed to "mild" arthritis. I personally didn't feel it was mild - I thought it was at least moderate - but I'm not a veterinarian...so...anywho, Cosequin is the 1st line of attack in arthritis. Lucy is 14#, takes 2 pills at night mixed in her soft food, and her limping has been absent for...5 yrs now??? So this stuff really works! I'm glad she didn't need to be treated with any hardcore prescriptions and that Cosequin is doing the trick :)
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work!
customer_reviews.text: My older cat (12) was getting a little wobbly in his back legs and I hate to see the big guy like that, so, I decided to try these capsules. Every day I sprinkle one on his wet food and he doesn't seem to be the wiser. They seem to have helped! He appears stronger and not shaky in his back legs. A good improvement and well worth trying for an older cat.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Justine

customer_reviews.title: Good for cat chronic pain
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended by the vet for my 7 year old cat who’s previous owners declawed both his front which has caused arthritis and chronic pain. Prior to using this product, he was hiding constantly. We put two capsules in half a can of wet food every other day at night for him. You can tell he still struggles a bit when going to lay down or get comfy, but he’s doing much better!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Cats pooping and peeing on the floor
customer_reviews.text: Like another reviewer, my cats have also began to pee and poop on the floor. They have never done this prior. So, I stopped giving this medication to them, today.
customer_reviews.author: A M

customer_reviews.title: Shake it up with dry food. No need to wet it
customer_reviews.text: .I adopted my cat last December. He had frail legs and arthritis on the back. My cat hates it when I sprinkle it on top while wetting his favorite dry food. I had to put half a cup of dry food and two tablets and shake it up in a container. He's now eating the whole bowl each day. His hind legs and back is less stiff and he is more playful. Still i have to massage him often too but I am seeing his health getting better each day. I tried their chewables but my cat refused to it. He is one picky mofo but I love him so much.
customer_reviews.author: LTHB

customer_reviews.title: My cat who has had a urinary blockage in the ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat who has had a urinary blockage in the past has one capsule a day of cosequin and it keeps him from blocking. I told my vet about them after she charged me a thousand dollars and kept my cat for a week with a catheter in him that I had found a miracle product to keep him from blocking and she didn’t want to hear about it. Veternarians I hope your listening.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for senior kits
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Cosequin for my two senior cats (12+) for a few months now, and the change is incredible. I initially purchased the treats because one cat is an extremely picky eater, but the value for the capsules is so much better I thought I'd try them at least once. I open the capsule and mix it into their wet food with no problems at all, even for the picky one. Their activity levels have increased, but most noticably to me is that they seem to be more content and sociable. So happy to see my old guys playing again!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Limp Be Gone
customer_reviews.text: So glad to have found this. My cat was limping pretty bad for a few days. Doc says hip displasia. After using his for a few days, his limp is gone... I have to say though, the person who said these are too big for their cat to swallow.... LMAO! You simply open these up and put in the food. I am shocked that my cat doesnt seem phased by it one bit. I would have paid GOOD MONEY to watch that reviewer feed one of these to his cat... LOL
customer_reviews.author: HY

customer_reviews.title: No more limping
customer_reviews.text: My 13 year old cat started limping slightly in the last few months. My vet told me to try a product like this. After just a week, the limp was gone. The capsules are easy to take apart and my kitties don't seem to mind the flavor as they still eat all the food ot is put on. I wish it came in a larger size because I've been giving it to both of my cats and it empties twice as quick.
customer_reviews.author: scroodles

customer_reviews.title: It helps
customer_reviews.text: I've noticed a slight difference with my 18yr old cat and how he walks. I think I need to order another bottle. We ran out and now he seems to be moving slower and more sure footed. The only thing I don't like about it is always having to disguise the powder in his food. He detects it if I don't mix it up well. He will reject if he detects. I usually mix it up with a half can of fancy feast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Administer & Somewhat Effective
customer_reviews.text: The price is affordable and my cat will easily lick up the powder on his wet food. I have been dosing my cat for a month now and he seems a little more comfortable. It's hard to tell with cats when they are in pain. He was walking very slowly before and now he seems to get around a bit easier. I will continue for another month to see if we do get some real progress. I can update the review at that time. The real trick is knowing if it really is doing anything to help relieve some pain for my furry friend.
customer_reviews.author: Marques Alan

customer_reviews.title: Health kitty equals happy owner
customer_reviews.text: My cat takes these for urinary health. He was getting obstructions that were causing me to take him to the emergency vet and spending $$$ to get him unblocked. We were looking at possible surgery that could have left him incontinent. *sigh* Luckily my veternarian suggested trying Cosequin first. I break open 2 capsules and mix them into soft food. He eats the soft food just fine. And no more blockages. Plus, the cost here on Amazon was better than ordering though the vets office or any veterinary pharmacy. The packaging looks just the same as it does coming from my vets office.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie J

customer_reviews.title: I will continue to use for my senior cat
customer_reviews.text: Easy to open and sprinkle capsules. I mix into wet food and my 2 cats have always eaten the entire plate so I can only assume the flavor is palatable. One star off because my senior cat still seems to have leg discomfort intermittently and he can’t exactly verbalize a pain score to me. But overall he’s more active and limber. I overall recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great for senior cats.
customer_reviews.text: I took anout 5-6 weeks, but I saw a noticeable improvement in my 17 year old cat. He wasn’t grooming himself like he used to, especially harder to reach areas. I thought maybe he was stiff and sore due to age. He’s back to his regular grooming routine and his coat is soft and shiny again. I will continue to give him Cosequin.
customer_reviews.author: Big Deal Lucille

customer_reviews.title: Price fluctuates but best deal online usually
customer_reviews.text: Price fluctuates but best deal online usually. Much cheaper than purchasing at the vet. My cat takes this for cystitis (spastic bladder, it calms the bladder). But it is great for cats with joint issues too. Some kind of fishy flavor, I just put right on my cats canned food and he eats it right up. Been taking it for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mont

customer_reviews.title: cats seem more spry and suffer less from arthritis
customer_reviews.text: I use this for two arthritic cats. one is more than the other. our vet told us to get this here cause it was a fraction of the price than what the vet office sold it for. worked the same she said. it does and we give it to them every night. it's sad when one of them inhale it because it doesnt always mix well sprinkled on top of dry food with water on it. but the more arthritic cat seems more spry after using this. we have it on auto ship and go through 2 bottles a month. I'm happy my cats feel better.
customer_reviews.author: Crossy JTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I see improvement in my cat
customer_reviews.text: My veterinarian recommended these for my cat as she seemed to be having difficulty jumping up on things. After being on them for 2 months I saw a difference as she does not hesitate any longer to jump up. She has been on them for over 6 months now and continues to show improvement. Possibly too much improvement as I have found evidence she was up on the kitchen counter while I was at work. Much cheaper than buying them at the vet's office as well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gunderson

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working so far!
customer_reviews.text: My poor Teaser is getting up there in years and she's been having trouble with climbing stairs and jumping onto the bed. I could tell her joints were paining her. I started giving her these capsules, just open one and pour it into her food every morning. She doesn't mind the taste and they seem to be helping her joints a lot. She's actually been downright chipper lately, playing and bouncing around like she used to when she was younger. As long as this keeps helping her I'll continue to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: SHouser

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: We use this for our library cat. I can't comment on the taste because I'm not the one using it but she doesn't seem to mind it mixed in her evening meal. It is helping her stiff legs and was recommended by our local vet.
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette J. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if Cosequin is different?
customer_reviews.text: My senior cat has taken Cosequin for over a year. When I opened the capsule to mix with my cat’s wet food, I noticed the powder looked slightly off color n’ a tad bit “chunky”??? The contents did not look as refined as my previous orders. I tried it and it gave my cat diarrhea. Not sure if it is my cat or this particular bottle, but I may have to try something else. This is the 2nd bottle I have returned from Amazon. That has me concerned. I’ve never had any problems until recently.
customer_reviews.author: JordanLuvsPugs

customer_reviews.title: I have my lively cat back!
customer_reviews.text: I had to wait to review this product because it does take a little time for it to work but when it does it doesn’t disappoint! I had noticed my 10 year old cat was starting to limp and not jumping up places on places she used to. It did take about 3 weeks to notice anything but now she’s acting like a young cat again! She’s more playful and running around being ornery again.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole V

customer_reviews.title: Seems to have helped our older cat
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a Veterinarian, or a doctor of any kind. I have joint issues.....I take Glucosamine/Chondroitin for those issues, and it seems to help me. When one of our older cats appeared to be having issues getting up from a nap, or heading down stairs, our Vet suggested we could try Cosequin and see if it helps him at all. I was a bit skeptical, but the difference was noticeable, and we decided to continue using the product with both of our cats. It's easy to pop open the capsules and sprinkle into wet food, and mixes in well. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gib L.

product_meta.title: Nutramax Cosequin Sprinkle Capsules for Cats
product_meta.description: Size:80 CountCosequin for Cats is a nutritional supplement to help your pet maintain healthy joints. As your pet ages, it’s common for his joints to become less flexible, which impacts his mobility and quality of life. Cosequin is the top recommended brand of veterinarians to support and maintain the health of your cat’s joints. The only joint health supplement brand that has been shown safe, effective, and bioavailable in peer-reviewed, published, controlled, U. S. veterinary studies. Cosequin for Cats helps support cartilage production and protect existing cartilage from breakdown. It’s manufactured following standards similar to those practiced by the pharmaceutical industry. Each capsule contains at least 125 milligrams of Glucosamine Hydrochloride, 100 milligrams of Sodium Chondroitin Sulfate, and 1 milligram of Manganese. Please read all label information on delivery. Indications: Stop Use Indications: Your veterinarian is your best ally in managing your pet’s health. If your pet has any condition that requires medical attention, you should always consult your veterinarian. Keep out of reach of children. For animal use only.
feature_bullets: Plays important role in helping to maintain joint health
Manufactured following standards similar to the pharmaceutical industry
Contains 125 milligrams FCHG49 Glucosamine and 100 milligrams TRH122 Chondroitin Sulfate per capsule
Please read all label information on delivery
